intro: Psychotria nudiflora var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved psychotria, is a species native to Central and South America. It is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, often found in humid, tropical environments. Its leaves are broad and elliptical, with a smooth texture and dark green color. The flowers are borne in clusters and are notable for their vibrant color and unique shape.
